授業目的: The objective of this course is to learn about India's rapid growth, focusing mainly on its economic development, and to understand its growth and challenges through examples of manufacturing and sustainable development. Students are preferable to earn 2 credits of “South Asian Society” before this course.
到達目標: Students are to understand the state of India's economic, industrial, and sustainable development through interactive online learning delivered from India, and to identify, analyze, and reflect on issues on their own.
授業方法:
This course will be held on in face-to-face lessons at the classroom. Students will attend Web seminar(Webinar) by online streaming (interactive format) by Professor Pritee Sharma from Indian Institute of Technology Indore (IIT-Indore) as a guest speaker.
Students are preferable to earn 2 credits of “South Asian Society” before this course.

本授業に際し、受講生は使用教室に来室し、対面にてゲストスピーカーによるオンラインストリーミング授業を受講するウェビナー形式にて参加すること。「オンライン」とあるが、従来の受講生、教員ともにオンライン上で同時双方向でやり取りを行う形式ではない。
本授業の受講に際しては「南アジア社会論」の2単位を修得済みであることが望ましい。

第2回: Indian Society (1): Indian Culture and Civilization
第5回: Indian Economy (1): India’s Economic Reforms, Agriculture, Poverty and Development
第6回: Indian Economy (2): Indian International Trade and Policy
第8回: Industries in India (1): Manufacturing Sector, Small and Medium Enterprises
第9回: Industries in India (2): Services Sector, IT and others
第11回: Indian International Relationships with Other Countries
第12回: Sustainable Development in India: Environment and Economic Development
第14回: Discussion and Wrap up for the report writing

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
Each course is positioned within the curriculum in accordance with the diploma policy and curriculum policy established by each undergraduate/graduate school. By proceeding with the study of this course with an awareness of the DP and CP, the following abilities expected by each undergraduate/graduate school will be developed.
Asia Studies:
1. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences.
2. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods.
3. Intercultural understanding and multicultural coexistence: the ability to be sensitive to different cultures and to coexist with diverse cultures.
